Description: Fragment of lip, neck and sub-round handle to sharp turn of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine pink-buff. Circular stamp with Helios head symbol.
Curator's comments: Name Kallikrates. From same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ABC 0148.28, but with different secondary stamp.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (108)
